action: I want to safely upload and manage business-related files such as contracts, invoices, and certificates
reason: To prevent the risk of loss due to paper or local storage and to centrally manage business evidence
acceptance_criteria: File upload is only executable by authenticated users.
Only roles with upload permissions can perform the operation.
Files can be linked to specific business data (customers, contracts, deals, etc.).
The link target ID is mandatory, and an existence check is performed.
File IDs are automatically numbered and unique.
Supported extensions are managed via a whitelist (e.g., pdf, jpg, png, docx, xlsx).
Upload fails for files with non-permitted extensions.
MIME type verification is implemented.
A maximum file size limit is set (e.g., 20MB).
Upload fails if the size is exceeded.
Virus scanning is executed as an asynchronous process.
Files with incomplete scans are managed with an 'Under Inspection' status.
Files are automatically isolated and made unavailable if a virus is detected.
File names are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Directory traversal attacks are prevented.
The storage path is not directly exposed.
Files are saved in encrypted storage.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
Files can only be retrieved via signed URLs.
Expiration times are set for the URLs.
Download operations are recorded in the audit log.
Logs are stored upon successful upload.
Error logs are stored upon failed upload.
Logs include the operating User ID.
Upload date and time are automatically recorded.
An updated date and time field must exist.
Logical deletion of files is possible.
Deletion is only possible by authorized users.
Audit logs are stored upon deletion.
Files are managed by internal identification IDs, even with the same file name.
Parameterized queries are used as SQL injection countermeasures.
The same validation applies to uploads via API.
Internal storage paths are not included in the response.
Rate limiting is applied (to prevent mass uploads).
A limit on the number of concurrent uploads is set.
Upload processing can be executed via an asynchronous queue.
A retry mechanism for failures exists.
Permission checks are performed when retrieving the file list.
Private files of other users are not viewable.
File versioning is possible.
Old version history is retained.
Meta-information before and after changes is saved in the change history.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Target response time for the upload API is within 500ms.
Internal system information is not returned to the client in case of errors.
